title: Bug 113047: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children nodes are not listed. The steps to reproduce this issue are as follows: 1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement. 2. The new data source should have no database/table/column information. The observed behavior is that there is no children node listing when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. Closing the data set editor and reopening it does not resolve the issue.
SR: Bug 113047: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. To reproduce this issue, follow these steps: 1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement. 2. Open the data set editor and navigate to the data source page. 3. Change the data source to a new one. The new data source should have no database/table/column information. The expected behavior is that the children nodes should be listed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. If the issue persists, try closing the data set editor and reopening it.
